table-reference.title: Continuous wire barrier construction – minimum required tension (N) for vertical or near-vertical stainless steel wires where the maximum clear spacing between the rails is 900mm

ol.li: Lay = number of strands by the number of individual wires in each strand. For example a lay of 7x19 consists of 7 strands with 19 individual wires in each strand.
Vertical wires require two pulley blocks to each 180° change of direction in the wire.
Near vertical wires may only require one pulley block for each change of direction.
Tension measured with a strain indicator.
The table only includes 7x7 and 7x19 wires due to other wires not having sufficient flexibility to make the necessary turns.
